summary: This bill, the NO TIME TO Waste Act, aims to reduce food loss and waste in the United States. It authorizes the Department of Agriculture to establish an Office of Food Loss and Waste to conduct research, offer grants for data collection on policies, and launch a public awareness campaign. The bill also supports food recovery infrastructure, encourages public-private partnerships, and strengthens interagency collaboration on food waste reduction. Furthermore, it amends existing legislation related to federal contractors and composting programs to align with the waste reduction goals.
